wikipedia_page.main: Alan Warren (born 13 December 1935) is a British sailor. He won a silver medal in the Tempest class with David Hunt at the 1972 Summer Olympics.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1972 Summer Olympics
response: * David Hunt and Alan Warren (Helmsman) — Sailing, Tempest
* Alan Warren (sailor) Olympic Silver Medalist lives in Worthing.

Alan Warren and David Hunt set their Tempest on fire. With this boat they won the silver medal in 1972 though during the transport to Canada the boat called "Gift 'orse" was damaged. Warren and Hunt ended in Kingston in 14th position. After the incident Warren stated: "The Horse was lame and we had to put her down."
* Alan Warren (priest) (born 1932), Anglican priest and author
David Charles Gower Hunt  (born 22 May 1934 in Woolwich, London) is an English sailor. He won a silver medal in the Tempest class with Alan Warren at the 1972 Summer Olympics.
* Alan Warren (priest) (1932-2020), Anglican priest and author
